result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Ross M Heeren. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a status, has requested electronic discovery two weeks ago, and received offer that contemplates AODA treatment up front. Defense requests more time for the Defendant to complete AODA treatment. 
Defense requests a status in December. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

9:40 AM . Defendant Ross M Heeren in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Ross M Heeren. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense was just appointed on these cases, and needs to get file from previous counsel. Defense also needs discovery and offer. 
Court sets another status. 
Defendant updates mailing address.
